channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Tens of thousands of Israelis take part in anti-gov’t protests
item.description: Protesters say Jerusalem rally is the biggest anti-government protest since Israel launched its war on Gaza in October.

item.title: Turkey’s opposition set to hold power in major cities, partial results show
item.description: Partial results in local elections show CHP candidates ahead of their AK Party rivals in Ankara and Istanbul.

item.title: Israeli military says it killed Hezbollah commander Ismail al-Zin
item.description: The commander, Ismail al-Zin, worked in the anti-tank missile unit of Hezbollah's Radwan forces.

item.title: At least four killed in Israeli attack on Al-Aqsa Hospital in Gaza
item.description: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said four people were killed and 17 others wounded in the air strike.

item.title: Will ultra-Orthodox Jewish Israelis serve in the military?
item.description: The government is under growing pressure to end a decades-long exemption for ultra-Orthodox Jews.

item.title: Photos: Aftermath of an Israeli air strike on hospital courtyard
item.description: Attack on Al-Aqsa Hospital courtyard kills at least two people and wounds several others, Palestinian officials say.

item.title: Two killed as Russia escalates attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure
item.description: Russia's attacks on such infrastructure in recent days have also caused severe power outages.

item.title: Bulgaria and Romania partially join Europe’s Schengen area
item.description: Schengen rules are not yet applicable to land borders due to Austria's concerns over undocumented migration.

item.title: Week in pictures: From a bridge collapse in the US to a protest in Brussels
item.description: A roundup of some of the main events last week.

item.title: The moment Israeli forces bomb tent at central Gaza hospital
item.description: Video captures the moment Israeli forces bomb a tent at the Al-Aqsa Hospital compound in Deir el-Balah.

item.title: ‘Fascism will not work in India’ says wife of arrested Modi critic
item.description: The wife of jailed Modi critic Arvind Kejriwal has condemned India’s ruling BJP.

item.title: Lost in Orientalism: Arab Christians and the war in Gaza
item.description: Centuries-old misconceptions compel Western Christians to ignore the plight of Palestinian Christians and Muslims.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 766
item.description: As the war enters its 766th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 177
item.description: Gaza's Media Office says Israel has committed 'a new massacre' by bombing inside the walls of Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital.

item.title: Pope renews call for Gaza ceasefire, release of captives in Easter address
item.description: Pope Francis says his thoughts go to those facing wars, especially children who have 'forgotten how to smile'.

item.title: Gaza’s Christians attend Easter service in darkness
item.description: The dwindling Christian community in Gaza is holding Easter services without electricity due to Israel’s siege.

item.title: The US ‘contingency plan’: Send Haitians to Guantanamo, again
item.description: The US is at the centre of the historical crisis in Haiti, and yet it would not give shelter to those trying to flee it.

item.title: ‘Humour is powerful’: Cartoons take on Uganda’s repressive government
item.description: Huge potholes and rundown hospitals are actually getting fixed – thanks to online satirical campaigns

item.title: Wael Dahdouh: Gaza’s voice amid loss and courage
item.description: Al Jazeera’s Gaza bureau chief bears scars of war, echoes resilience globally.

item.title: US firm AT&T says data of 73 million customers leaked on ‘dark web’
item.description: At least 7.6 million existing AT&T account holders and 65.4 million former users hit by the breach, the company says.

item.title: Babar Azam replaces Afridi as Pakistan white-ball cricket captain
item.description: The Pakistan Cricket Board has reappointed Babar Azam as white-ball captain ahead of June's T20 World Cup.

item.title: India opposition protests in capital over Kejriwal’s arrest before election
item.description: Rally held against arrest of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over long-running corruption probe ahead of election.

item.title: Biden’s ‘double talk’ on Gaza: Cynical election politics?
item.description: Kenneth Roth, ex-head of Human Rights Watch, dissects the US president's 'classic double talk' on Israel’s war in Gaza.

item.title: Turkey’s opposition in electoral battle to keep hold of major cities
item.description: CHP has control of local government in Istanbul and Ankara, but may find it hard to keep hold of them in March 31 vote.

item.title: Republican congressman suggests nuking Gaza
item.description: Republican Congressman Tim Walberg suggested dropping a nuclear bomb on Gaza ‘like Nagasaki and Hiroshima’.
